revised_title: Mapping Sea Urchin Mitochondrial DNA Replication Origins and Pause Sites
tldr: The authors used a combination of one- and two-dimensional agarose gel electrophoresis and solution hybridization to map the replication origin of sea urchin mitochondrial DNA and investigate the structure of replication intermediates. Their findings suggest that the D-loop region corresponds to the functional origin of replication and that synthesis proceeds in an initially unidirectional manner. The existence of replication pause sites, with the most prominent one coinciding with a major origin of lagging-strand synthesis, is also inferred.
